analyzed: 'jig rten na 'dres shing grags pa'i dngos po dang / sbyor ba dang ldan pa smra ba gang yin pa'o //

translated: For example,

original: sman pas nad pa la sman kha dog dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg phun sum tshogs pa dang / nus pa dang / smin pa dang / mthu che ba byin pa dang / de'i kha dog dang / dri dang / ro dang /
analyzed: sman pas nad pa la sman kha dog dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg phun sum tshogs pa dang / nus pa dang / smin pa dang / mthu che ba byin pa dang / de'i kha dog dang / dri dang / ro dang /
translated: The physician gives the patient medicine that is perfect in color, smell, taste, and touch, and in potency, ripening, and strength.

original: reg rnams ni gzung ba tsam du grags pa'i dmigs pa'i rten du gyur pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: reg rnams ni gzung ba tsam du grags pa'i dmigs pa'i rten du gyur pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The color, smell, taste, and touch of the medicine are to be regarded as the basis for the object of perception that is known as mere apprehension.

original: nus pa dang / sman pa dang / mthu che ba ni nad med par ma byas kyi bar du mngon par brtag par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nus pa dang / sman pa dang / mthu che ba ni nad med par ma byas kyi bar du mngon par brtag par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: The potency, the ripening, and the strength are not to be regarded as the basis for the object of perception that is known as mere apprehension until the disease has been cured.

original: byas pa'i 'og tu ni brtags zin pa yin te /
analyzed: byas pa'i 'og tu ni brtags zin pa yin te /
translated: But once the disease has been cured, they are to be regarded as the basis for the object of perception that is known as mere apprehension.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa ni gzung ba tsam du grags pa'i dmigs pa'i rten gyi yul du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa ni gzung ba tsam du grags pa'i dmigs pa'i rten gyi yul du rig par bya'o //
translated: This is how the object that is the basis for the object of perception that is known as mere apprehension should be understood.

original: yul la gnas pa'i rten gyi yul gang zhe na /
analyzed: yul la gnas pa'i rten gyi yul gang zhe na /
translated: What is the object that is the basis for the object of perception that is known as the object that is present?

original: yul gang yul la gnas pa'i dmigs pa'i rten gyi bya ba byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: yul gang yul la gnas pa'i dmigs pa'i rten gyi bya ba byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is any object that functions as the basis for the object of perception that is known as the object that is present.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: rnal 'byor spyod pas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pas /
translated: a yogin

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gi khams brtags @191a * //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gi khams brtags @191a * //
translated: He examines the earth, water, fire, and wind elements,

original: nas / chu la sar mos par byed pa na /
analyzed: nas / chu la sar mos par byed pa na /
translated: and when he wishes for water in the earth,

original: sa'i 'du shes kho nas gnas te /
analyzed: sa'i 'du shes kho nas gnas te /
translated: he remains only with the perception of earth,

original: chu'i 'du shes ni ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu'i 'du shes ni ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the perception of water disappears.

original: me dang rlung la sar mos pa na /
analyzed: me dang rlung la sar mos pa na /
translated: When he wishes for fire and wind in the earth,

original: sa'i 'du shes kho nas gnas te /
analyzed: sa'i 'du shes kho nas gnas te /
translated: he remains only with the perception of earth,

original: me dang rlung gi 'du shes ni ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me dang rlung gi 'du shes ni ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the perception of fire and wind disappear.

original: de'i sa'i 'du shes gang yin pa de ni yul gnas pa'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sa'i 'du shes gang yin pa de ni yul gnas pa'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: Whatever is his perception of earth is the object of the perception of the place.

original: sa gang yin pa de ni yul la gnas pa'i dmigs pa'i rten to //
analyzed: sa gang yin pa de ni yul la gnas pa'i dmigs pa'i rten to //
translated: Whatever is the earth is the basis of the object of the perception of the place.

original: sa la ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: sa la ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as with the earth,

original: chu dang / me dang rlung la yang ci rigs par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: chu dang / me dang rlung la yang ci rigs par blta bar bya ste /
translated: so also with water, fire, and wind, as is appropriate in each case.

original: 'di ni yul la gnas pa'i dmigs pa'i rten gyi yul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yul la gnas pa'i dmigs pa'i rten gyi yul zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the object of the basis of the object of the perception of the place.

original: de la yul la gnas pa'i dmigs pa'i rten gyi yul gang yin pa de ni mngon par brtags zin pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de la yul la gnas pa'i dmigs pa'i rten gyi yul gang yin pa de ni mngon par brtags zin pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Whatever is the object of the basis of the object of the perception of the place is not yet fully examined.

original: mngon par brtag par bya ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par brtag par bya ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not a matter of investigation.

original: khams rnams ni mos pa ma grub pa'i tshe ni mngon par brtag par bya ba yod do //
analyzed: khams rnams ni mos pa ma grub pa'i tshe ni mngon par brtag par bya ba yod do //
translated: When one has not yet attained the stage of conviction, the elements are a matter of investigation.

original: grub nas ni mngon par brtags zin pa yin te /🔽'di ni mngon par brtags zin pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: grub nas ni mngon par brtags zin pa yin te / 'di ni mngon par brtags zin pa yang ma yin /
translated: When one has attained it, they are already investigated.

original: brtag par bya ba yang ma yin pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtag par bya ba yang ma yin pa'i mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhes bya'o //
translated: This is direct perception that is neither already investigated nor a matter of investigation.

original: yul ma 'khrul pa'i mngon sum gang zhe na /🔽de ni rnam pa lnga 'am /
analyzed: yul ma 'khrul pa'i mngon sum gang zhe na / de ni rnam pa lnga 'am /
translated: What is direct perception that is not confused with regard to its object?

original: rnam pa bdun du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bdun du blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as being of five kinds or seven kinds.

original: rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five kinds?

original: rnam pa lngas 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa lngas 'khrul pa'o //
translated: It is confused in five ways.

original: rnam pa lngas 'khrul pa yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa lngas 'khrul pa yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five kinds of confusion?

original: 'du shes 'khrul pa dang / grangs 'khrul pa dang / dbyibs 'khrul pa dang / kha dog 'khrul pa dang / las 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes 'khrul pa dang / grangs 'khrul pa dang / dbyibs 'khrul pa dang / kha dog 'khrul pa dang / las 'khrul pa'o //
translated: Confusion of ideation, confusion of number, confusion of shape, confusion of color, and confusion of action.

original: 'khrul pa rnam pa bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa rnam pa bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven kinds of confusion?

original: 'khrul pa rnam pa lnga po 'di dag nyid kyi nang du kun du 'gro ba'i 'khrul pa rnam pa gnyis bsres nas 'khrul pa rnam pa bdun du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa rnam pa lnga po 'di dag nyid kyi nang du kun du 'gro ba'i 'khrul pa rnam pa gnyis bsres nas 'khrul pa rnam pa bdun du 'gyur ro //
translated: These five errors are combined with two universal errors, making seven errors.

original: 'khrul pa rnam pa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa rnam pa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two universal errors?

original: sems 'khrul pa dang / lta ba 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: sems 'khrul pa dang / lta ba 'khrul pa'o //
translated: The error of the mind and the error of views.

original: 'du shes pa 'khrul pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'du shes pa 'khrul pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the error of perception?

original: de'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa la der 'du shes pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa la der 'du shes pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the perception of something as something else, which it is not.

original: dper na 'od zer gyi mtshan ma can gyi smig rgyu ba la chur 'du shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'od zer gyi mtshan ma can gyi smig rgyu ba la chur 'du shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the perception of water in a mirage, which has the characteristics of light rays.

original: grangs 'khrul pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: grangs 'khrul pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the error of number?

original: nyung ngu la mang por mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa gang yin pa ste /🔽@191b dper na rab rib can gyis zla ba gcig pu la /
analyzed: nyung ngu la mang por mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa gang yin pa ste / @191b dper na rab rib can gyis zla ba gcig pu la /
translated: It is the overestimation of a small number as a large number.

original: zla ba mang po mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zla ba mang po mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a person with an eye disease sees one moon as many moons.

original: dbyibs 'khrul pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbyibs 'khrul pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the error of shape?

original: dbyibs gzhan la de las gzhan pa'i dbyibs su mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dbyibs gzhan la de las gzhan pa'i dbyibs su mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the overestimation of a particular shape as another particular shape.

original: dper na mgal me la 'khor lo'i dbyibs su mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mgal me la 'khor lo'i dbyibs su mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when a firebrand is whirled around, it appears in the form of a wheel.

original: kha dog 'khrul pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: kha dog 'khrul pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is error of color?

original: kha dog gzhan la de las gzhan pa'i kha dog tu mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: kha dog gzhan la de las gzhan pa'i kha dog tu mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the overesteeming of the self which is based on a color other than what it is.

original: dper na mig ser gyi nad kyis btab pa'i dbang pos gzugs ser po ma yin pa rnams la gzugs ser por mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig ser gyi nad kyis btab pa'i dbang pos gzugs ser po ma yin pa rnams la gzugs ser por mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a person with jaundice sees objects as yellow, even though they are not yellow.

original: las 'khrul pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: las 'khrul pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is error of action?

original: las med pa la las yod par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: las med pa la las yod par mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the overesteeming of the self which is based on the nonexistence of action.

original: dper na khu tshur dam du bcangs te rgyug pas shing phyir 'gro bar mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na khu tshur dam du bcangs te rgyug pas shing phyir 'gro bar mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a person who has been beaten with a whip thinks that the trees are moving.

original: sems 'khrul pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems 'khrul pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is error of mind?

original: 'khrul pa rnam pa lnga po de dag nyid kyis rnam par 'khrul pa'i don la sems mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa rnam pa lnga po de dag nyid kyis rnam par 'khrul pa'i don la sems mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the delight in the object of the five errors.

original: lta ba 'khrul pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: lta ba 'khrul pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is error of view?

original: 'khrul pa rnam pa lnga po nyid kyis rnam par 'khrul pa'i don la 'dod pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / rnam par gzhog pa dang / bkra shis pang 'du shis pa dang / mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa rnam pa lnga po nyid kyis rnam par 'khrul pa'i don la 'dod pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / rnam par gzhog pa dang / bkra shis pang 'du shis pa dang / mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the five kinds of error: error in regard to the object, error in regard to the manifestation, error in regard to the establishment, error in regard to the auspicious and inauspicious, and error in regard to the adherence.

original: mngon sum de su'i mngon sum du brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum de su'i mngon sum du brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: What is the direct perception of that?

original: mdor bsdu na bzhi ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na bzhi ste /
translated: In brief, it is fourfold:

original: dbang po gzugs can gyi mngon sum dang / yid kyis myong ba'i mngon sum dang / 'jig rten gyi mngon sum dang / dag pa'i mngon sum mo //
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can gyi mngon sum dang / yid kyis myong ba'i mngon sum dang / 'jig rten gyi mngon sum dang / dag pa'i mngon sum mo //
translated: direct perception of the physical sense faculties, direct perception of mental experience, direct perception of the world, and direct perception of purity.

original: dbang po gzugs can gyi mngon sum gang zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can gyi mngon sum gang zhe na /
translated: What is direct perception of the physical sense faculties?

original: ji skad bstan pa'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid kyis dbang po gzugs can lnga po rnams kyi spyod yul te yul gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid kyis dbang po gzugs can lnga po rnams kyi spyod yul te yul gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the object of the five physical sense faculties, which have the characteristics of direct perception as previously described.

original: yid kyis myong ba'i mngon sum gang zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyis myong ba'i mngon sum gang zhe na /
translated: What is direct perception of mental experience?

original: ji skad bstan pa'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid yid kyi spyod yul te yul gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid yid kyi spyod yul te yul gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the object of the mental faculty, which has the characteristics of direct perception as previously described.

original: 'jig rten gyi mngon sum gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mngon sum gang zhe na /
translated: What is direct perception of the world?

original: de gnyi ga gcig tu bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: de gnyi ga gcig tu bsdus pa ni /
translated: The combination of the two is called

original: 'jig rten gyi mngon sum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mngon sum zhes bya'o //
translated: direct perception of the world.

original: dag pa'i mngon sum gang zhe na /
analyzed: dag pa'i mngon sum gang zhe na /
translated: What is pure direct perception?

original: 'jig rten gyi mngon sum gang yin pa ni dag pa'i mngon sum yang de yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi mngon sum gang yin pa ni dag pa'i mngon sum yang de yin no //
translated: That which is direct perception of the world is also pure direct perception.

original: @192a * // ngag dag pa'i mngon sum yin la 'jig rten gyi mngon sum ma yin pa yang yod de /🔽'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul te yul gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: @192a * // ngag dag pa'i mngon sum yin la 'jig rten gyi mngon sum ma yin pa yang yod de / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul te yul gang yin pa ste /
translated: There is pure direct perception which is not direct perception of the world.🔽It is the object of supramundane direct perception.

original: yod pa la yang yod par /
analyzed: yod pa la yang yod par /
translated: It is the knowledge of what exists as existing,

original: med pa la yang med par /
analyzed: med pa la yang med par /
translated: of what does not exist as not existing,

original: bla na yod pa la yang bla na yod par /🔽bla na med pa la yang bla na med par shes pa ni 'jig rten pa rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: bla na yod pa la yang bla na yod par / bla na med pa la yang bla na med par shes pa ni 'jig rten pa rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: of what is surpassable as surpassable,🔽and of what is unsurpassable as unsurpassable.

original: 'di ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhes bya'o /🔽// / bam po bco brgyad pa /
analyzed: 'di ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma zhes bya'o / // / bam po bco brgyad pa /
translated: This is called the valid knowledge of direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is inference?

original: mngon par brtags pa dang bcas pas mngon par brtags pa dang / mngon par brtag par bya ba'i yul lo //
analyzed: mngon par brtags pa dang bcas pas mngon par brtags pa dang / mngon par brtag par bya ba'i yul lo //
translated: It is a conceptualized object because it is conceptualized.

original: de yang rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as being of five types:

original: rtags dang / ngo bo nyid dang / las dang / chos dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rtags dang / ngo bo nyid dang / las dang / chos dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: as a sign, as an essence, as an action, as a quality, and as a result.

original: rtags las rjes su dpag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtags las rjes su dpag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is inference through a sign?

original: de ltar ram sngon mthong ba'i mngon mtshan dang mtshan ma 'ga' zhig gis 'brel pa las yul mngon par brtags pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar ram sngon mthong ba'i mngon mtshan dang mtshan ma 'ga' zhig gis 'brel pa las yul mngon par brtags pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the conceptualizing of an object through a sign or through a previous experience.

original: dper na ru mtshon las shing rta rjes su dpag pa dang / dud pa las me dang / rgyal po las yul 'khor dang / khyim thab las bud med dang / nog dang rva las ba lang dang / byis pa dang / skra gnag pa dang /
analyzed: dper na ru mtshon las shing rta rjes su dpag pa dang / dud pa las me dang / rgyal po las yul 'khor dang / khyim thab las bud med dang / nog dang rva las ba lang dang / byis pa dang / skra gnag pa dang /
translated: For example, the inference of a chariot from its parts, of fire from smoke, of a king from his escort, of a woman from her ornaments, of an ox from its horns and hoofs, of a child from the womb, of the presence of water from the presence of cranes, and of the past and future from the present.

original: lang tsho gzhon pa las gzhon nu dang / gnyer ma dang / skra dkar la sogs pa las rgan po dang / rang gi cha lugs 'dzin pa las khyim pa'am /🔽rab tu byung ba dang / 'phags pa rnams la lta bar 'dod pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / ser sna dang bral ba las dad pa can dang / legs pa'i bsam pa sems pa dang / legs pa'i smra ba smra ba dang /
analyzed: lang tsho gzhon pa las gzhon nu dang / gnyer ma dang / skra dkar la sogs pa las rgan po dang / rang gi cha lugs 'dzin pa las khyim pa'am / rab tu byung ba dang / 'phags pa rnams la lta bar 'dod pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / ser sna dang bral ba las dad pa can dang / legs pa'i bsam pa sems pa dang / legs pa'i smra ba smra ba dang /
translated: They are young in comparison to those who are youthful, old in comparison to those who have wrinkles and gray hair, and so on, and they are householders or monastics in comparison to those who have taken up their respective ways of life.🔽They are faithful in comparison to those who are free of stinginess, who wish to see the noble ones, who listen to the sublime teachings, and who have a good attitude, who speak well,

original: legs pa'i bya ba'i las byed pa la mkhas pa dang / snying brtse ba dang / snyan par smra ba dang / brtan pa dang / sbar ma chums pa dang / zab mo'i don gyi dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
analyzed: legs pa'i bya ba'i las byed pa la mkhas pa dang / snying brtse ba dang / snyan par smra ba dang / brtan pa dang / sbar ma chums pa dang / zab mo'i don gyi dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
translated: who are skilled in performing good actions, who are compassionate, who speak pleasantly, who are steadfast, who are not fickle, and who explain the intended meaning of the profound teachings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang / rgod pa dang / 'phyar ba dang / co 'dri ba dang / rtse ba dang / ca co che ba las 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa dang / rtag tu spyod lam rab tu zhi ba las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang / rgod pa dang / 'phyar ba dang / co 'dri ba dang / rtse ba dang / ca co che ba las 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa dang / rtag tu spyod lam rab tu zhi ba las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
translated: the absence of desire for those who are not free from desire due to being agitated, excited, boisterous, playful, and talkative, and the absence of desire for those who are always calm in their behavior,

original: de bzhin gshegs @192b pa'i mtshan rnams dang / dpe byad bzang po rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / sgrub pa dang / mthu las de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad mkhyen pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @192b pa'i mtshan rnams dang / dpe byad bzang po rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / sgrub pa dang / mthu las de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad mkhyen pa dang /
translated: the marks of a tathāgata, the excellent minor marks, the wisdom of a tathāgata, tranquility, accomplishment, and power, the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened ones, the all-knowing ones,

original: gzhon nu'i tshe mthong ba'i mtshan ma las de nyid 'di yin no snyam du rgan po rjes su dpag pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa ni /
analyzed: gzhon nu'i tshe mthong ba'i mtshan ma las de nyid 'di yin no snyam du rgan po rjes su dpag pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa ni /
translated: the inference of an old man from the signs seen in youth, thinking, 'He is the same one,'

original: rtags las rjes su dpag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rtags las rjes su dpag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and what is similar to that should be known as inference from a sign.

original: ngo bo nyid las rjes su dpag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las rjes su dpag pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: lung bstan par rnam par gzhag pa yang yid ches pa dang / ma nges pa la gcig tu nges par rnam par 'jog par byed de /
translated: And also, the statement of a prophecy is a determination of what is not ascertained to be one thing,

original: dper na bde pa'i tshor ba thams cad las ni 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal thams cad las ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: dper na bde pa'i tshor ba thams cad las ni 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal thams cad las ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: for example, “Desire increases from all happy feelings” and “Hatred increases from all painful feelings.”

original: bde ba'i tshor ba zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad ni gcig tu nges par bde ba'o zhes bya ba dang / ched du bsams pa'i las kyis ni gcig tu nges par sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa 'ba' zhig myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang /🔽mtshan nyid yod la khyad par med pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni khyad par can du rnam par 'jog pa'am /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad ni gcig tu nges par bde ba'o zhes bya ba dang / ched du bsams pa'i las kyis ni gcig tu nges par sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa 'ba' zhig myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / mtshan nyid yod la khyad par med pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni khyad par can du rnam par 'jog pa'am /
translated: And also, the statement that all contaminated happy feelings are definitely happy and that the definitely painful karmic maturation is experienced due to intentional karma is a determination of what is not ascertained to be one thing.

original: khyad par can gyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni khyad par med par rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni khyad par med par rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: And also, the statement that the characteristic that exists without distinction is a distinction or that the characteristic that is a distinction is without distinction is a determination of what is not ascertained to be one thing.

original: dper na 'dus byas la khyad par can gyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de yang /🔽'dus ma byas su rnam par 'jog par byed /
analyzed: dper na 'dus byas la khyad par can gyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de yang / 'dus ma byas su rnam par 'jog par byed /
translated: For example, the characteristic of the conditioned that is a specific characteristic is also posited as the unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas la khyad par med pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de yang 'dus byas su rnam @194b par 'jog par byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la khyad par med pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de yang 'dus byas su rnam @194b par 'jog par byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: The characteristic of the unconditioned that is a non-specific characteristic is also posited as the conditioned.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs can rnams dang gzugs med pa rnams dang / bstan du yod pa rnams dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / thogs pa med pa rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa rnams dang /🔽zag pa med pa rnams la sogs pa la yang ci rigs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs can rnams dang gzugs med pa rnams dang / bstan du yod pa rnams dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / thogs pa med pa rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa rnams dang / zag pa med pa rnams la sogs pa la yang ci rigs su rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as it is for the conditioned and the unconditioned, so it is for the material and the immaterial, the demonstrable and the indemonstrable, the resistant and the non-resistant, the contaminated and the uncontaminated, and so on.

original: mtshan nyid yod pa kho na la yang rgyu dang / 'bras bus rigs pa ma yin par gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid yod pa kho na la yang rgyu dang / 'bras bus rigs pa ma yin par gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: The characteristic that is a cause and the characteristic that is an effect are not logically possible for something that exists only as a characteristic.

original: dper na legs par spyod pa'i 'bras bu mi sdug par 'gyur ba dang / nyes par spyod pa'i sdug bar 'gyur ba dang / nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la log par bsgrubs pas rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la yang dag par bsgrubs pas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bar rnam par 'jog pa dang /🔽gdags par smra bas yongs su ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid la /
analyzed: dper na legs par spyod pa'i 'bras bu mi sdug par 'gyur ba dang / nyes par spyod pa'i sdug bar 'gyur ba dang / nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la log par bsgrubs pas rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la yang dag par bsgrubs pas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bar rnam par 'jog pa dang / gdags par smra bas yongs su ma grub pa'i mtshan nyid la /
translated: For example, the result of good conduct is posited as ugly, the result of bad conduct is posited as beautiful, the practice of the Dharma and Vinaya that is badly explained is posited as pure, and the practice of the Dharma and Vinaya that is well explained is posited as defiled.

original: gdags par sma bas yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: gdags par sma bas yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par 'jog pa ste /
translated: The Proponents of Designation posit the characteristic of non-establishment as the characteristic of establishment.🔽For example, all inexpressible phenomena are posited as the ultimate, which is expressible.

original: dper na brjod du med pa'i chos thams cad la brjod par don dam pa rnam par 'jog pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa ni mtshan nyid mi mthun par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na brjod du med pa'i chos thams cad la brjod par don dam pa rnam par 'jog pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa ni mtshan nyid mi mthun par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Such are to be viewed as having dissimilar characteristics.

original: de las bzlog pa ni mtshan nyid mi mthun pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni mtshan nyid mi mthun pa med pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is having similar characteristics.

original: de ni mtshan nyid mi mthun pa med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni mtshan nyid mi mthun pa med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the absence of a dissimilar example.

original: 'di ni yid ches pa'i lung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yid ches pa'i lung zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the authoritative scriptural passage.

original: gang gi tshe chos thams cad rang rang gi chos nyid la gnas par rang gi mtshan nyid la gnas kyi grub pa'i tshe ci'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i don rnam pa gnyis bstan zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos thams cad rang rang gi chos nyid la gnas par rang gi mtshan nyid la gnas kyi grub pa'i tshe ci'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i don rnam pa gnyis bstan zhe na /
translated: When all things are established in their own natures, in their own characteristics, why are the two kinds of objects to be established taught?

original: pha rol yid ches pa bskyed pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: pha rol yid ches pa bskyed pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: It is in order to generate conviction in others,

original: mtshan nyid bskyed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bskyed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: not in order to generate characteristics.

original: ci'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i don bsgrub par thog mar dam bca' bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i don bsgrub par thog mar dam bca' bar byed ce na /
translated: Why is a thesis stated at the beginning in order to establish the object to be established?

original: 'di ltar 'dod cing bsams pa'i don yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod cing bsams pa'i don yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is in order to announce the meaning that is desired and intended.

original: ci'i phyir gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub ce na /
translated: Why is it established by means of a reason?

original: 'di ltar mthong ba'i dngos po la brten pa'i rigs pas dam bcas pa'i don de nyid pha rol 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba'i dngos po la brten pa'i rigs pas dam bcas pa'i don de nyid pha rol 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is in order to cause the opponent to grasp the meaning of the thesis through the reasoning based on the seen thing.

original: ci'i phyir dpe bsgrub ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dpe bsgrub ce na /
translated: Why is it established by means of an example?

original: 'di ltar mthong ba'i dngos po ni /🔽rigs pa de nyid @195a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong ba'i dngos po ni / rigs pa de nyid @195a * //
translated: Thus, the entity that is seen

original: kyi gnas yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyi gnas yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is taught to be the locus of that very reasoning.

original: ci'i phyir mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa dang / mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung bsgrub ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa dang / mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung bsgrub ce na /
translated: Why is it that the agreement, the disagreement, the perception, the inference, and the authoritative testimony are established?

original: 'di ltar gtan tshigs dang / dper brjod pa de gnyis kyi 'gal ba dang / mi 'gal ba'i shes pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gtan tshigs dang / dper brjod pa de gnyis kyi 'gal ba dang / mi 'gal ba'i shes pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the knowledge of the contradiction and the non-contradiction of those two, the reason and the example, is taught.

original: 'gal ba de yang rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba de yang rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya ste /
translated: And that contradiction should be understood in two ways:

original: ma nges pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang 'dra bas so //
analyzed: ma nges pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang 'dra bas so //
translated: as indeterminate and as similar to what is to be established.

original: mi 'gal pa ni rnam pa gnyis kho nas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mi 'gal pa ni rnam pa gnyis kho nas rig par bya ste /
translated: The non-contradiction should be understood in just two ways:

original: gcig tu nges pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: gcig tu nges pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i khyad par gyis so //
translated: as determined as one and as distinguished by what is to be established.

original: gang na 'gal ba yod pa de ni dam bcas par bsgrub pa tshad mar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: gang na 'gal ba yod pa de ni dam bcas par bsgrub pa tshad mar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Where there is contradiction, that is not a valid means of knowledge because the establishment of the thesis is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: gang la 'gal ba med pa de ni dam bcas pa bsgrub pa la tshad mar bya ba yin pa'i phyir tshad ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang la 'gal ba med pa de ni dam bcas pa bsgrub pa la tshad mar bya ba yin pa'i phyir tshad ma zhes bya ste /
translated: The one who is free from contradiction is considered to be authoritative in establishing a thesis, and so is called a valid person.

original: 'di ni smra ba'i gnas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni smra ba'i gnas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called the locus of speech.

original: smra ba'i rgyan gang zhe na /
analyzed: smra ba'i rgyan gang zhe na /
translated: What is the ornament of speech?

original: de ni rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as fivefold:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,🔽knowledge of one's own and others' doctrines,🔽skill in the composition of sentences, fearlessness,

original: bdag dang pha rol gyi lugs shes pa dang / tshig gi sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / brten pa dang / ngo mi bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang pha rol gyi lugs shes pa dang / tshig gi sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / brten pa dang / ngo mi bzlog pa'o //
translated: steadfastness, and the absence of deceitfulness.

original: bdag dang pha rol gyi lugs shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdag dang pha rol gyi lugs shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is knowledge of one's own and others' doctrines?

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig chos 'dul ba la mngon par dga' ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig chos 'dul ba la mngon par dga' ste /
translated: Here, some people are devoted to the Dharma and Vinaya.

original: bstan bcos dang / lugs dang / grub pa'i mtha' de la 'don pa dang / dga' ba dang / nyan pa dang / bsams pa dang / yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sgrub pas mkhas par byas shing tshig gis goms par byas te /
analyzed: bstan bcos dang / lugs dang / grub pa'i mtha' de la 'don pa dang / dga' ba dang / nyan pa dang / bsams pa dang / yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sgrub pas mkhas par byas shing tshig gis goms par byas te /
translated: They become learned in the treatises, the doctrines, and the tenets by reciting them, taking pleasure in them, listening to them, reflecting on them, maturing them, and practicing them. They become skilled in the composition of sentences and are familiar with the words.

original: byang bar byas pa gang yin pa dang / gzhan yang chos 'dul ba la mngon par mi 'dod cing /
analyzed: byang bar byas pa gang yin pa dang / gzhan yang chos 'dul ba la mngon par mi 'dod cing /
translated: It is also the case that one does not like the Dharma and Vinaya,

original: mngon par mi dga' ste /
analyzed: mngon par mi dga' ste /
translated: and is not pleased with it.

original: pha rol gyi bstan bcos dang / pha rol gyi lugs dang / pha rol gyi grub pa'i mtha' de la 'don pa dang / dga' ba dang / nyan pa dang / bsams pa dang / yongs su smin par byed la /
analyzed: pha rol gyi bstan bcos dang / pha rol gyi lugs dang / pha rol gyi grub pa'i mtha' de la 'don pa dang / dga' ba dang / nyan pa dang / bsams pa dang / yongs su smin par byed la /
translated: One recites, delights in, listens to, reflects on, and cultivates the treatises, systems, and tenets of others.

original: sgrub par ni mi byed de /
analyzed: sgrub par ni mi byed de /
translated: But one does not practice them.

original: mkhas par byas shing tshig gis goms par byas te /
analyzed: mkhas par byas shing tshig gis goms par byas te /
translated: One becomes learned in them, familiar with the words,

original: byang bar byas pa gang yin pa 'di ni bdag dang pha rol gyi lugs shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang bar byas pa gang yin pa 'di ni bdag dang pha rol gyi lugs shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and skilled in them. This is called “knowing one’s own and others’ systems.”

original: tshig sbyor ba phun sum @195b tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshig sbyor ba phun sum @195b tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the excellence of verbal expression?

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig tshig zur phyin pas smra ba po yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig tshig zur phyin pas smra ba po yin gyi /
translated: It is the case that someone here speaks with words that are well-formed,

original: tshig zur mi phyin pas ma yin pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: tshig zur mi phyin pas ma yin pa lta bu ste /
translated: not with words that are not well-formed.

original: tshig gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshig gang zhe na /
translated: What are words?

original: de ni yon tan rnam pa lnga dang ldan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni yon tan rnam pa lnga dang ldan par rig par bya ste /
translated: They should be known as having five qualities.

original: grong mi'i skad ma yin pa dang / yang ba dang / brjid pa dang / 'brel pa dang / don bzang po yin no //
analyzed: grong mi'i skad ma yin pa dang / yang ba dang / brjid pa dang / 'brel pa dang / don bzang po yin no //
translated: It is not the language of the village, it is light, it is majestic, it is connected, and it has a good meaning.

original: ji ltar grong mi'i skad ma yin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar grong mi'i skad ma yin pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not the language of the village?

original: yul ngan pa dang / yul 'khor ngan pa dang / yul mi ngan pa'i skad ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yul ngan pa dang / yul 'khor ngan pa dang / yul mi ngan pa'i skad ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not the language of a bad country, a bad region, or bad people.

original: ji ltar na yang ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yang ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it light?

original: 'jig rten na grags shing shin tu rigs pa'i tshig sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten na grags shing shin tu rigs pa'i tshig sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: It uses words that are well known and appropriate in the world.

original: ji ltar na brjid pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na brjid pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it majestic?

original: don gang brjod pa'i skabs su bab pa'i don de bsgrub pa'i phyir legs par sbyar zhing mthu yod pa'o //
analyzed: don gang brjod pa'i skabs su bab pa'i don de bsgrub pa'i phyir legs par sbyar zhing mthu yod pa'o //
translated: It is well formed in order to accomplish the meaning that is appropriate to the occasion, and it is powerful.

original: ji ltar na 'brel pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'brel pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it connected?

original: chos dang don snga ma dang phyi ma mi 'brel ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang don snga ma dang phyi ma mi 'brel ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not unconnected with the previous and following Dharma and meanings.

original: ji ltar na don bzang pa yin zhe na /🔽mngon par mtho ba'am /🔽nges par legs pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: ji ltar na don bzang pa yin zhe na / mngon par mtho ba'am / nges par legs pa las brtsams te /
translated: How does it have a good meaning?🔽It is unmistaken with regard to the higher realms

original: phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: and the definite goodness of liberation.

original: tshig zur phyin par smra ba rnams kyi tshig sbyor ba de yang 'di ltar rnam pa dgu phun sum tshogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshig zur phyin par smra ba rnams kyi tshig sbyor ba de yang 'di ltar rnam pa dgu phun sum tshogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: The speech of those who speak with well-rounded speech is also to be understood as being endowed with nine aspects.

original: ma 'tshal ba dang / nyes par rtsom pa ma yin pa dang / brda phrad pa dang / ran pa dang / don dang ldan pa dang / dus dang / sbyor ba dang / bstan pa dang / gsal ba dang / rgyun chags pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'tshal ba dang / nyes par rtsom pa ma yin pa dang / brda phrad pa dang / ran pa dang / don dang ldan pa dang / dus dang / sbyor ba dang / bstan pa dang / gsal ba dang / rgyun chags pa'o //
translated: It is not unclear, not faulty, intelligible, appropriate, meaningful, timely, connected, instructive, and clear.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni tshig sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni tshig sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: All of these together are called “well-rounded speech.”

original: 'di ni tshig sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshig sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “well-rounded speech.”

original: mi 'jigs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is fearlessness?

original: 'di ltar 'di ni kha cig ris kyi 'khor mang po rnam pa sna tshogs kyi ris dang / rags pa'i ris dang / mngon par zhen pa'i ris dang / tshogs pa'i ris dang / mkhas pa'i ris kyi nang du yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni kha cig ris kyi 'khor mang po rnam pa sna tshogs kyi ris dang / rags pa'i ris dang / mngon par zhen pa'i ris dang / tshogs pa'i ris dang / mkhas pa'i ris kyi nang du yang rung ste /
translated: Here, in the midst of a great assembly of various kinds of people, of people of different kinds, of people of coarse kinds, of people of clinging kinds, of people of assembled kinds, and of people of learned kinds,

original: sems zhum pa med pa dang / sems dman pa med pa dang / sems 'jigs pa med pa dang / lus mi rdul ba dang / bzhin mi 'gyur ba dang / skad mi 'dar ba dang / gcom mi chung bar tshig smra ba ste /
analyzed: sems zhum pa med pa dang / sems dman pa med pa dang / sems 'jigs pa med pa dang / lus mi rdul ba dang / bzhin mi 'gyur ba dang / skad mi 'dar ba dang / gcom mi chung bar tshig smra ba ste /
translated: It is to be without mental lassitude, without mental inferiority, without mental fear, without a trembling body, without a contorted face, without a stammering voice, and to speak with confidence.

original: 'di ni mi 'jigs pa zhes bya ba'o //🔽brtan @196a * //
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'jigs pa zhes bya ba'o // brtan @196a * //
translated: This is called “fearlessness.”

original: pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is “steadfastness?”

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig dus la bab pa na tshig dal bus smra bar byed kyi rings par mi smra ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig dus la bab pa na tshig dal bus smra bar byed kyi rings par mi smra ba lta bu ste /
translated: It is to be like someone who, when the time has come, speaks slowly and not hastily.

original: 'di ni brtan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brtan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “steadfastness.”

original: ngo mi bzlog ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: ngo mi bzlog ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is “not turning back?”

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig des shing gzhan dag la rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig des shing gzhan dag la rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa'i rang bzhin can yin pas /
translated: It is to be like someone who, being gentle, does not harm others.

original: de des pa rnams kyi des pa'i tshul gang yin pa de las 'gal bar mi byed pas /
analyzed: de des pa rnams kyi des pa'i tshul gang yin pa de las 'gal bar mi byed pas /
translated: He does not contradict the way of gentleness that is proper for the gentle.

original: pha rol gyi sems srung zhing tshig smra ba ste /
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems srung zhing tshig smra ba ste /
translated: He speaks in a way that protects the minds of others.

original: de yang dus la bab pa dang / bden pa dang / don dang ldan pa dang / 'jam pa dang / mdza' ba'i tshul gyis byed pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: de yang dus la bab pa dang / bden pa dang / don dang ldan pa dang / 'jam pa dang / mdza' ba'i tshul gyis byed pa lta bu ste /
translated: It is timely, truthful, meaningful, gentle, and loving.

original: 'di ni ngo mi bzlog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ngo mi bzlog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “not turning away from the truth.”

original: smra ba'i rgyan rnam pa lnga po'i skabs de lta bu 'di la yang phan yon rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: smra ba'i rgyan rnam pa lnga po'i skabs de lta bu 'di la yang phan yon rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: “In this context of the five ornaments of speech, there are twenty-seven benefits that should be understood.

original: nyi shu rtsa bdun po gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa bdun po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty-seven?

original: 'khor gyi nang du shin tu bkur bar 'gyur zhing /

original: khyod kyi ni legs par brtags pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi ni legs par brtags pa'o //

original: bdag gi ni rigs pa ma yin no //

original: khyod kyi ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyi ni rigs pa yin no //

original: bdag gi ni 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi ni 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: What I said was not connected.

original: khyod kyi ni 'brel ba yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyi ni 'brel ba yin no //

original: bdag gi smra ba ni tshar chod par gyur to //
analyzed: bdag gi smra ba ni tshar chod par gyur to //
translated: My speech was defeated.

original: khyod kyi smra ba ni brtan por gyur to //
analyzed: khyod kyi smra ba ni brtan por gyur to //

original: 'dir bdag gi spobs pa ni 'di tsam du zad do //
analyzed: 'dir bdag gi spobs pa ni 'di tsam du zad do //
translated: My eloquence has come to an end.

original: phyi ma ni bsams te smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi ma ni bsams te smra bar bya'o //

original: de tsam gyis chog gi yang brjod par mi bya'o zhes zer ba ste /🔽ngag gi rnam par rig byed rnam pa bcu gsum po 'dis phyir smra ba la rnam par rig @197a * //

analyzed: par byed cing brjod pa'i skabs yongs su gtong ngo //

translated: Having given up, one is defeated, destroyed, vanquished, turned away, conquered.

original: de lta bas na brjod pa gtong ba chad pas bcad pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na brjod pa gtong ba chad pas bcad pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //

original: brjod pa sma dbab pa gang zhe na /

translated: They are impatient, they display bad omens, they remain silent, they are absent, they hunch their shoulders, they lower their heads, they are preoccupied,🔽

original: spobs pa med par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: spobs pa med par gyur ba'o //
translated: or by not speaking, or by remaining silent, or by shrugging one's shoulders, or by shaking one's head, or by a change in facial expression, or by not having the courage to speak.

analyzed: gzhan nas gzhan du gyur pa ji lta bu zhe na / dam bcas pa snga ma btang nas / dam bcas pa gzhan la 'chel ba dang / gtan tshigs dang dper brjod pa dang / mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa dang / mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung snga ma btang ste /
translated: What is a change of subject?

original: yid ches pa'i lung gzhan la 'chel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung gzhan la 'chel bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the abandoning of a former proposition and the taking up of another one, or the abandoning of a former reason, example, illustration, inference, or scriptural authority and the taking up of another one.

original: ma gtogs pa'i gtam gleng ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ma gtogs pa'i gtam gleng ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is a digression?

original: brjod pa'i skabs btang nas kha zas kyi gtam dang / skom gyi gtam dang / rgyal po'i gtam dang / chom rkun gyi gtam dang / bar srang gi gtam dang / smad 'tshong ma'i gtam dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa'i gtam gang yin pa rnams brjod pa ni /
analyzed: brjod pa'i skabs btang nas kha zas kyi gtam dang / skom gyi gtam dang / rgyal po'i gtam dang / chom rkun gyi gtam dang / bar srang gi gtam dang / smad 'tshong ma'i gtam dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa'i gtam gang yin pa rnams brjod pa ni /
translated: When the time for discussion is over, he engages in talk about food, drink, kings, thieves, streets, and prostitutes.

original: brjod pa'i skabs su ma gtogs pa'i gtam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: brjod pa'i skabs su ma gtogs pa'i gtam zhes bya ste /

analyzed: lan btab pa btang nas de dag gleng bar byed do //

analyzed: khro ba ston pa ji lta bu zhe na /
