analyzed: 'das pa la ni rnam par rtog / ces bya ba ni /
translated: “One imagines the past. . . .”

original: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig tu gyur to zhes mtshan mar gzung du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig tu gyur to zhes mtshan mar gzung du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible to apprehend it as a sign, thinking, “It was like this and like that.”

original: myong ba 'ba' zhig la rtog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: myong ba 'ba' zhig la rtog pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not only the experience that is imagined,

original: ma myong ba ma 'ongs pa la mtshan mar gzung du med bzhin du'ang @208b rnam par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: ma myong ba ma 'ongs pa la mtshan mar gzung du med bzhin du'ang @208b rnam par rtog par byed do //
translated: because one imagines the future, which has not been experienced, even though it cannot be apprehended as a sign.

original: 'dis ni rtog pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa da ltar byung ba'i 'du byed la brten pa ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rtog pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa da ltar byung ba'i 'du byed la brten pa ston to //
translated: This shows that the present formative forces are based on the defilement that arises from the cause of imagination.

original: 'du byed rnams ni thog ma med //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni thog ma med //
translated: Formative forces are beginningless,

original: 'on kyang thog ma yod par snang /🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang thog ma yod par snang / zhes bya ba ni /
translated: but they appear to have a beginning.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dus te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dus te /
translated: This refers to the time of defilement,

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir dang / gsar du skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir dang / gsar du skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is related to the beginningless past and because it is newly produced.

original: 'di man chad kyis ni rnam par byang ba'i phyogs ston to //
analyzed: 'di man chad kyis ni rnam par byang ba'i phyogs ston to //
translated: From here on he shows the side of purification.

original: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa dbu pa rdos pa la sogs pa lta bur rang gi mtshan nyid dang / skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gag pa mtshungs pas 'dus byas kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa dbu pa rdos pa la sogs pa lta bur rang gi mtshan nyid dang / skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gag pa mtshungs pas 'dus byas kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are the general characteristics of conditioned phenomena, like a clay pot, etc., in terms of their own characteristics, arising, enduring, and ceasing.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i bden pas yongs su brtags na rnam par byang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i bden pas yongs su brtags na rnam par byang bar 'gyur te /
translated: They are purified by the general characteristics, the conventional, and ultimate reality.

original: 'di ltar gti mug par byed pa gang yang med la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gti mug par byed pa gang yang med la /
translated: In this way, there is no delusion at all.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i gti mug ni med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i gti mug ni med pa ma yin te /
translated: But the delusion of dependent origination is not nonexistent.

original: kun rdzob tu na gti mug ni rmongs par byed pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu na gti mug ni rmongs par byed pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Delusion is said to be a delusion conventionally.

original: gang gi phyir rmongs pa med pa la ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa med de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rmongs pa med pa la ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa med de /
translated: Because there is no incorrect mental activity for one who is not deluded,

original: de bas na gti mug de rmongs par mi byed do zhes ston to //
analyzed: de bas na gti mug de rmongs par mi byed do zhes ston to //
translated: therefore, that delusion does not cause delusion.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang kun rdzob tu na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang kun rdzob tu na /
translated: In the same way, consciousness is also conventionally

original: bsod nams la sogs pa'i 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba zhes bya'i /
analyzed: bsod nams la sogs pa'i 'du byed du nye bar 'gro ba zhes bya'i /
translated: “They are called ‘formations that lead to merit, etc.’

original: don dam par ni nye bar 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: don dam par ni nye bar 'gro ba med do //
translated: But ultimately, they do not lead anywhere.

original: gsum du 'dod ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsum du 'dod ces bya ba ni /
translated: “Three kinds” means

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba rnams so //
translated: past, future, and present.

original: las rnams gsum po gang yin pa //
analyzed: las rnams gsum po gang yin pa //
translated: “Whatever the three kinds of actions are”

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

original: lus la sogs pa'i las so //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i las so //
translated: the actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: de dag kun kyang 'brel pa med //
analyzed: de dag kun kyang 'brel pa med //
translated: “They are all unrelated”

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: means

original: phan tshun 'grogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phan tshun 'grogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: that they do not accompany each other.

original: 'di ltar da ltar gyi rnams ni 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar da ltar gyi rnams ni 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can yin la /
translated: The present ones are in the process of perishing;

original: 'das pa rnams ni gang na yang mi gnas pa dang / ma skyes pa rnams ni rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa rnams ni gang na yang mi gnas pa dang / ma skyes pa rnams ni rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the past ones do not exist anywhere; and the future ones are not yet born, because they depend on conditions.

original: sems ni phyi bzhin 'brang ba yin //
analyzed: sems ni phyi bzhin 'brang ba yin //
translated: “The mind follows after them”

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

original: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: that it is associated with them.

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: “In that case,

original: ji ltar bsod nams la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams 'brel pa med pa de bzhin du /🔽de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyang de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar bsod nams la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams 'brel pa med pa de bzhin du / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyang de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the formations of merit, etc. are not related,🔽so too the mind associated with them would be like that.

original: @209a * // 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
analyzed: @209a * // 'gyur ba'i rigs na /
translated: If that is so,

original: ji ltar de nye bar 'gro bar 'gyur /🔽gang gi phyir sems 'du byed gang dang mtshungs par ldan pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar de nye bar 'gro bar 'gyur / gang gi phyir sems 'du byed gang dang mtshungs par ldan pa'am /
translated: how could it approach?

original: yang na mi ldan par gyur na /
analyzed: yang na mi ldan par gyur na /
translated: Because the mind is either associated with or not associated with the formations.🔽If it were not associated with them,

original: de ni de dang nams kyang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: de ni de dang nams kyang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'am /
translated: it would never be associated with them,

original: yang na mi ldan pa yang ma yin par mi 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: yang na mi ldan pa yang ma yin par mi 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
translated: or it would not be non-associated with them.

original: sems thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'am /
analyzed: sems thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'am /
translated: It is not associated with all minds,

original: mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it not associated with them.

original: de lta na yang dag par sems kyi nye bar 'gro ba ma grub pa kun rdzob tu /🔽sems ni nye bar 'gro zhes bya //
analyzed: de lta na yang dag par sems kyi nye bar 'gro ba ma grub pa kun rdzob tu / sems ni nye bar 'gro zhes bya //
translated: In that case, the unestablished approach of the mind is conventionally

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: called “the mind approaches.”

original: gtan tshigs gang gis ston zhe na //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang gis ston zhe na //
translated: How is that taught?

original: rgyun ni 'dra dang mi 'dra ba //
analyzed: rgyun ni 'dra dang mi 'dra ba //
translated: The continuum is similar and dissimilar.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas ston to //🔽kun rdzob 'di ni bya ba yin //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas ston to // kun rdzob 'di ni bya ba yin //
translated: This is taught by the verse beginning with “This is the conventional truth.”

original: zhes bya ba ni de nye bar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de nye bar 'gro ba'o //
translated: “This is the conventional truth” is the approach to it.

original: ji ltar byed pa po dang / tshor ba po yang dag par med bzhin du yang zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byed pa po dang / tshor ba po yang dag par med bzhin du yang zhe na /
translated: “How is it that the agent and the experiencer are not real?”

original: kun rdzob tu bdag gis byas pa la nye bar spyad pa zhes bya ba yang bstan to //🔽snga dang phyi mas tha dad cing //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu bdag gis byas pa la nye bar spyad pa zhes bya ba yang bstan to // snga dang phyi mas tha dad cing //
translated: “The self is conventionally said to be the one who does and experiences.”🔽“The self is different in the past and the future.”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas ni /
translated: This is taught by the verse beginning with “If it is different in the past and the future.”

original: ji ltar yang des byed cing des myong ngam /
analyzed: ji ltar yang des byed cing des myong ngam /
translated: “How is it that it does and experiences?”

original: 'on te gzhan gyis zhes bya ba lung du mi bstan pa de yongs su ston to //🔽de lta na bdag po'am /🔽byed pa po'am /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis zhes bya ba lung du mi bstan pa de yongs su ston to // de lta na bdag po'am / byed pa po'am /
translated: “It is indeterminate whether it is the same or different.”

original: tshor ba po yang dag par med kyi /
analyzed: tshor ba po yang dag par med kyi /
translated: “In that case, it is not the self that is the owner, the agent, or the experiencer.”

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa tsam las rgol ba'i lan gdab pa'am /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa tsam las rgol ba'i lan gdab pa'am /
translated: “The self is not real, but cause and effect are real.”

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid dang / de nyid la bdag tu phyin ci log pa ni tshigs su bcad pa lngas ston to //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid dang / de nyid la bdag tu phyin ci log pa ni tshigs su bcad pa lngas ston to //
translated: The characteristics of cause and effect, and the error of positing a self in those two, are taught in five verses.

original: de la ji ltar bdag med bzhin du yang srid pa 'byung zhing rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / ji ltar rgyu las 'bras bu cig car mi 'byung ba dang / ji ltar thams cad las thams cad mi 'byung ba dang / ji ltar rgyu'i lam de rgyun chad par mi 'gyur ba de ni tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ston te /
analyzed: de la ji ltar bdag med bzhin du yang srid pa 'byung zhing rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / ji ltar rgyu las 'bras bu cig car mi 'byung ba dang / ji ltar thams cad las thams cad mi 'byung ba dang / ji ltar rgyu'i lam de rgyun chad par mi 'gyur ba de ni tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis ston te /
translated: Therein, one verse teaches how existence occurs and continues without a self, how an effect does not arise from a cause simultaneously, how everything does not arise from everything, and how the stream of causes is not interrupted.

original: rtsa ba bzhis rgol ba bzhi'i lan go rims bzhin du 'debs so //
analyzed: rtsa ba bzhis rgol ba bzhi'i lan go rims bzhin du 'debs so //
translated: The four roots reply to the four objections in order.

original: gnyis pas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ston to //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ston to //
translated: The second teaches the characteristics of cause and effect.

original: phyi ma gsum gyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu bdag med pa de la ji ltar bdag tu lta bar phyin ci log pa ston to //
analyzed: phyi ma gsum gyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu bdag med pa de la ji ltar bdag tu lta bar phyin ci log pa ston to //
translated: The last three teach the error of positing a self in the selflessness of cause and effect.

original: de yang dmigs pa dang / rten dang / 'bras bu dang / rgyu las ston te /
analyzed: de yang dmigs pa dang / rten dang / 'bras bu dang / rgyu las ston te /
translated: Moreover, that is taught in terms of object, basis, effect, and cause.

original: de'i @209b dmigs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstan to //
analyzed: de'i @209b dmigs pa ni tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bstan to //
translated: Its object is indicated in one verse.

original: de yang gzugs med pa dang / bstan du med pa gnyis kyis so so rang gis rig par sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: de yang gzugs med pa dang / bstan du med pa gnyis kyis so so rang gis rig par sgrub par byed de /
translated: And that is established as being known by oneself through the two, namely, as formless and as imperceptible.

original: gzugs rnams ni brtag tu rung ba'o zhes mdo las 'byung bas brtag tu med pa'i phyir dang / gzhan dag la bstan du mi rung bas bstan du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs rnams ni brtag tu rung ba'o zhes mdo las 'byung bas brtag tu med pa'i phyir dang / gzhan dag la bstan du mi rung bas bstan du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is said in the scriptures that forms are perceptible, it is imperceptible because it is not perceptible.

original: rten dang 'bras bu ni gnyis pas bstan to //
analyzed: rten dang 'bras bu ni gnyis pas bstan to //
translated: Its basis and result are indicated in the second verse.

original: byis pa rnams ni rten yin no //
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni rten yin no //
translated: The childish are its basis.

original: de las gzhan pa'i lta ba rnams ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i lta ba rnams ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The other views are its result.

original: rgyu ni gsum pas bstan te /
analyzed: rgyu ni gsum pas bstan te /
translated: Its cause is indicated in the third verse.

original: de la lhan cig skyes pa'i bdag tu lta ba ni ril por 'dzin pa dang / de'i bag la nyal rang gi sa bon las byung ngo //
analyzed: de la lhan cig skyes pa'i bdag tu lta ba ni ril por 'dzin pa dang / de'i bag la nyal rang gi sa bon las byung ngo //
translated: Among them, the innate view of a self arises from the seed of its own latent impressions, which is the grasping of a unity.

original: mu stegs can gyi bdag tu lta ba yongs su brtags pa ni sngon goms pa la sogs pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi bdag tu lta ba yongs su brtags pa ni sngon goms pa la sogs pa las 'byung ste /
translated: The imputed view of a self of the tīrthikas arises from previous habituation and so on.

original: mu stegs can gyi lta ba de yang goms par gyur la /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi lta ba de yang goms par gyur la /
translated: And that view of the tīrthikas is also familiar.

original: 'dir yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa la rtog cing /
analyzed: 'dir yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa la rtog cing /
translated: And here, there is incorrect conception.

original: de dang mthun pa'i dam pa'i chos ma yin pa yang pha rol las thos te /
analyzed: de dang mthun pa'i dam pa'i chos ma yin pa yang pha rol las thos te /
translated: And from others, one hears what is not the true Dharma that accords with that.

original: de ltar rten dang / yid la byed pa dang / dmigs pa'i nyes pa rnams kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag tu lta ba 'byung ba ston to //
analyzed: de ltar rten dang / yid la byed pa dang / dmigs pa'i nyes pa rnams kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag tu lta ba 'byung ba ston to //
translated: Thus, the arising of the view of self that is imputed by the faults of the basis, mental activity, and the object is shown.

original: de'i 'og tu ji ltar bdag tu lta ba des kun nas 'byung ba'i go rims gyis sdug bsngal 'grub par byed pa dang / ji ltar sdug bsngal de nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal gnyis kyi rgyur 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar na thar pa'i bgegs su 'gyur ba de ni tshigs su bcad pa lngas bstan te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ji ltar bdag tu lta ba des kun nas 'byung ba'i go rims gyis sdug bsngal 'grub par byed pa dang / ji ltar sdug bsngal de nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i sdug bsngal gnyis kyi rgyur 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar na thar pa'i bgegs su 'gyur ba de ni tshigs su bcad pa lngas bstan te /
translated: The next five verses show how, by the power of that view of self, suffering is produced in sequence, how that suffering becomes the cause of the two sufferings along with pride, and how it becomes an obstacle to liberation.

original: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang pos kun 'byung ba ston to //
analyzed: de la tshigs su bcad pa dang pos kun 'byung ba ston to //
translated: The first verse shows origination.

original: gnyis pa dang gsum pas ni sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal du bsdus pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de la de gnas par byas nas /
analyzed: gnyis pa dang gsum pas ni sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal du bsdus pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de la de gnas par byas nas /
translated: The second and third lines show that the store consciousness is included in the suffering of suffering and the suffering of the composite, and that it is the basis for the arising of the other two kinds of suffering.

original: 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhig gu snyam pa la sogs par spros pa khas len to //
analyzed: 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhig gu snyam pa la sogs par spros pa khas len to //
translated: The fourth line shows that the store consciousness is the basis for the arising of the other two kinds of suffering.

original: gnas byas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas byas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “it is the basis for the arising” means

original: lus yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: that it is the support for the body.

original: skad cig tsam yang zhi bar mi 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: skad cig tsam yang zhi bar mi 'gyur ba ni /
translated: The phrase “it is never at peace even for a moment” means

original: sdug bsngal de yang dus thams cad du rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de yang dus thams cad du rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: that this suffering is always present.

original: bzhi pas ni ji ltar sdug bsngal ba de sdug bsngal gzhan gnyis dang / nga rgyal gyi rkyen yin pa ston to //🔽lnga pas ni ji ltar thar pa'i @210a * //
analyzed: bzhi pas ni ji ltar sdug bsngal ba de sdug bsngal gzhan gnyis dang / nga rgyal gyi rkyen yin pa ston to // lnga pas ni ji ltar thar pa'i @210a * //
translated: The fifth line shows how the store consciousness is the cause of the other two kinds of suffering and of pride.

original: bgegs su 'gyur ba ston to //
analyzed: bgegs su 'gyur ba ston to //
translated: The sixth line shows how the store consciousness is an obstacle to liberation.🔽The phrase “it is the cause of the most extreme delusion” means

original: der ni lhag par kun du rmongs par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gzhan gnyis las lhag pa'o //
analyzed: der ni lhag par kun du rmongs par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gzhan gnyis las lhag pa'o //
translated: that it is the cause of the most extreme delusion among the three kinds of suffering.

original: kun du 'gro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun du 'gro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “it is universal” means🔽that it is present in all the stages.

original: tshor ba thams cad kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows after all feelings.

original: kun la spyod par byed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun la spyod par byed ces bya ba ni /
translated: “One engages in all”

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la'o //
translated: means that one engages in virtue, nonvirtue, and the undefined.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes par gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal de mtsho dang 'dra bar bstan nas /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes par gtogs pa'i sdug bsngal de mtsho dang 'dra bar bstan nas /
translated: Having taught that the suffering that belongs to the store-consciousness is like a lake,

original: da ni skom par 'gyur ba ston te /
analyzed: da ni skom par 'gyur ba ston te /
translated: now he teaches that it is like a thirst.

original: chos spyod pa kho nas skom par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos spyod pa kho nas skom par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one thirsts only through the practice of the Dharma.

original: de la mi bzad pa'i rgyun rnams ni /
analyzed: de la mi bzad pa'i rgyun rnams ni /
translated: There, the “unbearable currents”

original: mig la sogs pa drug dang / 'gro ba lnga dang / khams gsum la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa drug dang / 'gro ba lnga dang / khams gsum la sogs pa'o //
translated: are the six sense-faculties of eye, etc., the five destinies, the three realms, and so on.

original: chos spyod pa de yang 'ching ba dang / thar pa yongs su shes par bstan to //
analyzed: chos spyod pa de yang 'ching ba dang / thar pa yongs su shes par bstan to //
translated: The practice of the Dharma is taught as the thorough knowledge of bondage and liberation.

original: de la 'ching ba yongs su shes pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'ching ba yongs su shes pa ni /
translated: There, the thorough knowledge of bondage

original: 'di ltar yongs su shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su shes pa ste /
translated: is this kind of knowledge:

original: sdug bsngal la yang sdug bsngal lo snyam du 'dzin pa dang / bde na yang bdag nyid bde'o snyam du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la yang sdug bsngal lo snyam du 'dzin pa dang / bde na yang bdag nyid bde'o snyam du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: when there is suffering, one holds that there is suffering, and when there is happiness, one holds that there is happiness.

original: yongs su rtog pa de yang lta ba skyed par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa de yang lta ba skyed par byed pa yin la /
translated: And that imagination is the generator of the view.

original: lta ba de nyid las kyang de 'byung ste /
analyzed: lta ba de nyid las kyang de 'byung ste /
translated: And that view arises from that imagination.

original: de ni skyed pa yin no //🔽thar pa yongs su shes pa ni /
analyzed: de ni skyed pa yin no // thar pa yongs su shes pa ni /
translated: That is the generator.

analyzed: 'jums pa dang ni mchog tu chags //

analyzed: rtog pa zhes @212b ni bya ba ste //

analyzed: 'dod rnams de ltar shes nas ni //

analyzed: ji lta bur yang chags mi bya //

original: dam pa'i chos ni rtag tu nyon //

analyzed: mthong nas gcig tu nges par bsgom //

original: nyon mongs gnas ngan len spangs la //
analyzed: nyon mongs gnas ngan len spangs la //

analyzed: spong ba la yang dga' bar gyis //

original: mtshan ma la yang dpyad par bya //
analyzed: mtshan ma la yang dpyad par bya //

original: sbyor ba nyams su blang bar bya //
analyzed: sbyor ba nyams su blang bar bya //

analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags bral ba dang / gzugs kyi 'dod chags bral bar bya //

original: bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya //
analyzed: bden pa mngon par rtogs par bya //

original: kun nas 'dod chags bral bar bya //
analyzed: kun nas 'dod chags bral bar bya //

original: de bzhin phung po zad par bya //
analyzed: de bzhin phung po zad par bya //

original: bslab pa rnams la pha rol gshegs //
analyzed: bslab pa rnams la pha rol gshegs //

analyzed: the tshom thams cad sel mdzad pa // bslab dang bslab rnams bslab bgyi ba //

analyzed: gang lags zhu na bdag la gsungs //

original: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa thun mong ma yin pa las kyang brtsams /
analyzed: rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa thun mong ma yin pa las kyang brtsams /

original: bstod pa sngar byas nas /
analyzed: bstod pa sngar byas nas /
translated: Having praised him in the past,

analyzed: bslab pa rnams gang yin pa dang / du yod pa dang / de dag la ji ltar bslab par bgyi zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: he asks, “What are the trainings? How many are there? How should I train in them?”

original: de nas bcom ldan @213a * //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan @213a * //
translated: Then the Bhagavān,

analyzed: 'das kyis bya ba mang pos skrag pa dang // le lo'i rang bzhin can rnams spro ba skyed par dgongs nas bslab pa thams cad bsdus te /
translated: thinking to encourage those who are afraid of many activities and those who are lazy, summarized all the trainings,

original: grogs po mdor na bslab pa gsum //
analyzed: grogs po mdor na bslab pa gsum //
translated: and said, “Friend, in brief, the trainings are three.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims lhag pa'i sems //🔽lhag pa'i shes rab de dag la //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims lhag pa'i sems // lhag pa'i shes rab de dag la //
translated: The higher morality, the higher mind,🔽and the higher wisdom.

original: bslab pa gang yin mnyan par gyis //
analyzed: bslab pa gang yin mnyan par gyis //
translated: Listen to what the trainings in those are.”

original: zhes mdor bslab pa gsum du bstan to //
analyzed: zhes mdor bslab pa gsum du bstan to //
translated: Thus he taught the trainings in brief as three.

analyzed: de la tshul khrims dang / sems dang / shes rab kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to that, in terms of morality, mind, and wisdom,🔽he taught the three trainings in order to eliminate the three faults of laziness,

original: sems rnam par g-yeng ba la /
analyzed: sems rnam par g-yeng ba la /
translated: forgetting the instruction, and incorrect mental activity.

translated: In order to demonstrate the application of mental equipoise in the mind, he taught the training in superior mind.

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / mnyam par gzhag tu zin kyang /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / mnyam par gzhag tu zin kyang /
translated: Even though one has equipoise,

original: sems rnam par ma grol ba la /
analyzed: sems rnam par ma grol ba la /
translated: if the mind is not liberated,🔽in order to demonstrate the application of liberation, he taught the training in superior wisdom.

original: rnam par grol ba'i sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bya ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas na /🔽bslab pa thams cad bslab pa gsum po 'di dag ni nang du bsdu ba'i dgongs pas /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bya ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas na / bslab pa thams cad bslab pa gsum po 'di dag ni nang du bsdu ba'i dgongs pas /
translated: Since all the activities of the yogis who train in that are completed,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan to //🔽de dag la bslab par bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan to // de dag la bslab par bya ba ni /
translated: the Bhagavān taught with the intention of subsuming all trainings within these three trainings.🔽That which is to be trained in

original: sbyor ba gang gis bslab pa de dag rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba gang gis bslab pa de dag rdzogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: is the application by which those trainings are completed.

original: de la yan lag drug dang ldan pa dang / gnas bzhi bde dang ldan pa dang // bzhi po yi ni rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: de la yan lag drug dang ldan pa dang / gnas bzhi bde dang ldan pa dang // bzhi po yi ni rnam pa bzhi //
translated: it has four aspects,

original: rtag tu ye shes dag pa yin //
analyzed: rtag tu ye shes dag pa yin //
translated: and it is always pure knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni go rims bzhin du bslab pa gsum po de dag la bslab pa ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni go rims bzhin du bslab pa gsum po de dag la bslab pa ston te /
translated: This verse shows that the three trainings are taught in order by the six branches, the four abodes, the four aspects, and the purity of knowledge.

original: yan lag drug dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yan lag drug dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It has six branches.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'i dbang du byas nas bslab pa ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'i dbang du byas nas bslab pa ste /
translated: This shows the training in the higher training in morality.

original: yan lag drug ni /
analyzed: yan lag drug ni /
translated: The six branches are

original: tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / so so thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa dang / cho ga dang ldan pa dang / spyod yul dang ldan pa dang / kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas pa dang / so so thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa dang / cho ga dang ldan pa dang / spyod yul dang ldan pa dang / kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba dang /
translated: to abide with morality, to be restrained by the vows of individual liberation, to have proper conduct, to have a proper range of activity, to see danger in the slightest faults,

original: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs nas slob pa ste /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs nas slob pa ste /
translated: and to train in taking up the bases of training.

original: yan lag drug po de dag gis tshul khrims rnam par dag pa bzhi bstan to //
analyzed: yan lag drug po de dag gis tshul khrims rnam par dag pa bzhi bstan to //
translated: These six branches teach the four pure moralities.

original: de la tshul khrims dang ldan par @213b gnas zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la tshul khrims dang ldan par @213b gnas zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Here, the phrase abiding in morality is the topic.

original: so sor thar ba'i sdom pas bsdams zhes bya ba 'dis ni nges par 'byin pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag par bstan te /
analyzed: so sor thar ba'i sdom pas bsdams zhes bya ba 'dis ni nges par 'byin pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag par bstan te /
translated: The phrase restrained by the vows of individual liberation indicates the purity of the morality of renunciation.

original: nges par 'byin pa ni thar pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa ni thar pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: Renunciation is in terms of liberation.

original: cho ga dang spyod yul dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis ni tshul khrims ma smad pa rnam par dag pa bstan to //🔽kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: cho ga dang spyod yul dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis ni tshul khrims ma smad pa rnam par dag pa bstan to // kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam dag la yang 'jigs par lta ba zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The two phrases with proper conduct and with proper behavior indicate the purity of irreproachable morality.

original: tshul khrims ma nyams pa rnam par dag pa bstan to //🔽bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs te slob ces bya bas ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims ma nyams pa rnam par dag pa bstan to // bslab pa'i gzhi rnams yang dag par blangs te slob ces bya bas ni /
translated: The phrase viewing with dread even the slightest transgression indicates the purity of uncorrupted morality.

original: tshul khrims phyin ci ma log pa rnam par dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshul khrims phyin ci ma log pa rnam par dag pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase having taken up the bases of training, he trains in them indicates the purity of unperverted morality.

original: de ltar yan lag rnam pa drug dang ldan pas lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'i sbyor ba la brten nas /
analyzed: de ltar yan lag rnam pa drug dang ldan pas lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'i sbyor ba la brten nas /
translated: Thus, by means of the six aspects, one relies on the training in superior morality.🔽The four abodes of happiness

original: gnas bzhi bde dang ldan pa dang // zhes bya bas ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa'i sbyor ba ston te /
analyzed: gnas bzhi bde dang ldan pa dang // zhes bya bas ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa'i sbyor ba ston te /
translated: indicate the training in superior mind.

original: sems kyi gnas pa rnam pa bzhi ni bsam gtan bzhi yin la /
analyzed: sems kyi gnas pa rnam pa bzhi ni bsam gtan bzhi yin la /
translated: The four abodes of mind are the four meditative concentrations.

original: de yang tshe 'di nyid la bde bar gnas pa yin pas na bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang tshe 'di nyid la bde bar gnas pa yin pas na bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since one abides in happiness in this very life, they are called “happiness.”

original: bzhi po yi ni rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: bzhi po yi ni rnam pa bzhi //
translated: The four have four aspects

original: rtag tu ye shes dag pa yin //
analyzed: rtag tu ye shes dag pa yin //
translated: and are always pure in terms of gnosis.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is stated

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'i sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'i sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa yin te /
translated: from the perspective of the training in superior wisdom.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi bden pa bzhi po dag las re re la yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dag pa bzhi bzhis lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro /

translated: purity by abandoning the cause of the counteragent and by relying on the cause of the antidote.

original: mdza' sde dag kyang yong mi bya //
analyzed: mdza' sde dag kyang yong mi bya //
translated: One should not have friends🔽who cause grief and distraction.

original: sdug bsngal skyed pa'i nyon mongs rnams //
analyzed: sdug bsngal skyed pa'i nyon mongs rnams //
translated: The afflictions that give rise to suffering

original: byung ba dang du blang mi bya //
analyzed: byung ba dang du blang mi bya //
translated: One should not accept what has happened.

original: zhes bya bas ni /🔽ji ltar khyim pa rnams dang lhan cig 'dre ba mya ngan dang / rnam par g-yeng ba byas bas nyon mongs pa rnam par 'phel bas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa dang // @217b ji ltar 'phags pa dang 'dre ba sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i nyon mongs pa skyes pa dang du len par mi byed pas gnyen po'i rgyur 'gyur ba de ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni / ji ltar khyim pa rnams dang lhan cig 'dre ba mya ngan dang / rnam par g-yeng ba byas bas nyon mongs pa rnam par 'phel bas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa dang // @217b ji ltar 'phags pa dang 'dre ba sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i nyon mongs pa skyes pa dang du len par mi byed pas gnyen po'i rgyur 'gyur ba de ston to //
translated: This shows🔽how, for householders, associating with others and the distraction that results from it cause the afflictions to increase and so are the cause of suffering.

original: brtul zhugs nyams pas ji ltar yang //
analyzed: brtul zhugs nyams pas ji ltar yang //
translated: And how, for the noble ones, associating with others is the cause of the antidotes, since they do not accept the arising of the afflictions that give rise to suffering.

original: dad pas byin pas spyad mi bya //🔽dam pa'i chos rnams ji ltar yang //
analyzed: dad pas byin pas spyad mi bya // dam pa'i chos rnams ji ltar yang //
translated: One should not use the gifts of the faithful🔽to support a life of broken vows.

original: yongs su spang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su spang bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not completely abandon🔽the teachings of the true Dharma.

original: zhes bya bas ni /🔽rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mngon bar chags pa med pa dang / lta ba ngan ba mngon par zhen pa med pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni / rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mngon bar chags pa med pa dang / lta ba ngan ba mngon par zhen pa med pa ni /
translated: This shows

original: dad pas byin pa chud mi gzon pa dang / dam pa'i chos mi spong bas /
analyzed: dad pas byin pa chud mi gzon pa dang / dam pa'i chos mi spong bas /
translated: that those who are not attached to gain and honor and those who are not attached to bad views do not waste the gifts of the faithful and do not abandon the true Dharma.

original: phyi ma la yang 'dod pa la lhag par chags pa dang / lta ba ngan pa'i skye pa'i rgyu yongs su spong pas rnam par dag ba'i khyad par ston to //
analyzed: phyi ma la yang 'dod pa la lhag par chags pa dang / lta ba ngan pa'i skye pa'i rgyu yongs su spong pas rnam par dag ba'i khyad par ston to //
translated: The latter shows the purity of the bodhisattva who has abandoned the cause of the arising of attachment to sense-objects and of bad views.

original: pha rol dag gi 'khrul skyon la //
analyzed: pha rol dag gi 'khrul skyon la //
translated: Do not think about the faults of others,

original: mi bsam bde bar 'gyur bar bya //
analyzed: mi bsam bde bar 'gyur bar bya //
translated: but rather be happy.

original: bdag gi 'khrul pa'i nyes pa ni //
analyzed: bdag gi 'khrul pa'i nyes pa ni //
translated: Having recognized your own faults,

original: shes par byas nas bsgrags par bya //🔽zhes bya bas ni /🔽gzhan gyi nyes pa mthong nas bsam pa rnam par spangs pa dang / rang gi dge ba'i phyogs mi 'dor bas yid bde ba skyes pa'i phyir bdag gi nyes pa yongs su shes nas sgrogs pas nga rgyal med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes par byas nas bsgrags par bya // zhes bya bas ni / gzhan gyi nyes pa mthong nas bsam pa rnam par spangs pa dang / rang gi dge ba'i phyogs mi 'dor bas yid bde ba skyes pa'i phyir bdag gi nyes pa yongs su shes nas sgrogs pas nga rgyal med pa'i phyir /
translated: make them known to others.

original: bslab pa rnam par dag pa ston to //
analyzed: bslab pa rnam par dag pa ston to //
translated: This shows the purity of training.

original: de bzhin nyes pa byung ba la //
analyzed: de bzhin nyes pa byung ba la //
translated: Having seen the faults of others,

original: chos bzhin du ni rab tu bya //
analyzed: chos bzhin du ni rab tu bya //
translated: you should act in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de bzhin las su bya ba rnams //
analyzed: de bzhin las su bya ba rnams //
translated: In the same way, you should do

original: rang gis bya zhing grims par bya //
analyzed: rang gis bya zhing grims par bya //
translated: whatever needs to be done yourself.

original: zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni /
translated: This shows the purity of training.

original: nyes pa las dbyung ba dang / gzhan dag la rim gro dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba bdag gir bya bar 'dod pa yongs su spangs pas kyang /
analyzed: nyes pa las dbyung ba dang / gzhan dag la rim gro dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba bdag gir bya bar 'dod pa yongs su spangs pas kyang /
translated: He also shows purity by abandoning the desire to be the one to rescue from faults, to serve, and to honor others.

original: rnam par dag pa ston to //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ston to //
translated: He shows purity by abandoning the desire to be the one to rescue from faults, to serve, and to honor others.

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang nyan thos kyi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang nyan thos kyi //
translated: The faithful see the Buddha and the disciples

original: mthu stobs dang ni bstan pa la //🔽dad ldan kha na ma tho ba //🔽mthong bas skur pa yang mi gdag //
analyzed: mthu stobs dang ni bstan pa la // dad ldan kha na ma tho ba // mthong bas skur pa yang mi gdag //
translated: as having power and strength and as teachers.🔽They do not deny them

original: ces bya bas ni /
analyzed: ces bya bas ni /
translated: because of seeing the faults of others.

original: dad pa dang ldan pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa la kha na ma tho ba yin par lta bas rnam par dag pa bstan to //🔽rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa //
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa la kha na ma tho ba yin par lta bas rnam par dag pa bstan to // rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa //
translated: This shows purity by seeing the faults of those who deny the Buddha and the disciples.

original: shin tu zab mo'i chos rnams la //
analyzed: shin tu zab mo'i chos rnams la //
translated: The Dharma is very profound and is not the domain of sophistry.

original: sngon gyi lung rnying yongs btang ste //
analyzed: sngon gyi lung rnying yongs btang ste //
translated: Abandoning the old scriptures of the past,

original: rang lta mchog tu gzung mi bya //🔽zhes bya bas ni /🔽rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la gnas pa yongs su spangs pas kyang /
analyzed: rang lta mchog tu gzung mi bya // zhes bya bas ni / rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la gnas pa yongs su spangs pas kyang /
translated: one should not hold one’s own view as supreme.

original: rnam par dag pa'i khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i khyad par bstan to //
translated: This shows the special purity by abandoning the view that one’s own view is supreme.

original: bas mtha' yi ni mal stan du //
analyzed: bas mtha' yi ni mal stan du //
translated: And in the bed of the forest's edge,

original: rnam par dben par gnas par bya //🔽dge @218a * //
analyzed: rnam par dben par gnas par bya // dge @218a * //
translated: Dwell in solitude.

original: ba'i chos rnams bsgom par bya //
analyzed: ba'i chos rnams bsgom par bya //
translated: Cultivate the wholesome states,

original: brtson 'grus brtun ba brten por bya //🔽zhes bya bas ni /🔽lus dang sems rnam par dben pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang mthun pa'i mal stan bsten pa dang / mi dge ba la rtog pa spong zhing gcig tu nges par dkar po'i chos sgom pa dang // bying ba dang rgod pa la sogs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis zil gyis mi non pas /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtun ba brten por bya // zhes bya bas ni / lus dang sems rnam par dben pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang mthun pa'i mal stan bsten pa dang / mi dge ba la rtog pa spong zhing gcig tu nges par dkar po'i chos sgom pa dang // bying ba dang rgod pa la sogs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis zil gyis mi non pas /
translated: And be firm in the practice of diligence.🔽This shows the special means for training in superior thought, because it is the completion of the practice, since one is not overcome by the secondary defilements of torpor, restlessness, etc.,

original: sbyor ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir lhag pa'i sems la bslab pa'i thabs kyi khyad par ston to //
analyzed: sbyor ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir lhag pa'i sems la bslab pa'i thabs kyi khyad par ston to //
translated: one resorts to a bed that is conducive to concentration, and one cultivates the wholesome states exclusively, without any consideration of the unwholesome.

original: 'dun pa med cing 'dun bskyed //
analyzed: 'dun pa med cing 'dun bskyed //
translated: One who is without aspiration generates aspiration,

original: sdang ba med cing sun 'byin pa //🔽gnyid mi log cing dus su nyal //
analyzed: sdang ba med cing sun 'byin pa // gnyid mi log cing dus su nyal //
translated: One who is hostile is without hostility,🔽One who is sleepy is not drowsy,

original: zhi bar yang ni gnas mi byed //
analyzed: zhi bar yang ni gnas mi byed //
translated: And one who is not sleepy goes to bed at the proper time.

original: 'gyod pa med la 'gyod dang bcas //
analyzed: 'gyod pa med la 'gyod dang bcas //
translated: One who is not regretful has regret,

original: som nyi med cing 'dod par byed //
analyzed: som nyi med cing 'dod par byed //
translated: One is free of doubt and has confidence.

original: rnam pa kun dang dus kun ldan //
analyzed: rnam pa kun dang dus kun ldan //
translated: One is endowed with all aspects and all times.

original: yang dag sbyor dang ldan pa yin //
analyzed: yang dag sbyor dang ldan pa yin //
translated: One is endowed with correct application.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyis ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyis ni /
translated: These two verses show that by completely abandoning the obscurations of

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyi sgrib pa yongs su spangs pas /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyi sgrib pa yongs su spangs pas /
translated: desire, malice, torpor, sleep, excitation, regret, and doubt,🔽one has the aspiration and desire for virtuous qualities, one is free of

original: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang / 'dod pa la sun 'byin pa dang / dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba la /🔽nyams bde bar bya ba'i rgyus dus su gnyid la brten pa dang / sems zhi bar byed pa na bying bar gyur tam /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang / 'dod pa la sun 'byin pa dang / dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba la / nyams bde bar bya ba'i rgyus dus su gnyid la brten pa dang / sems zhi bar byed pa na bying bar gyur tam /
translated: discouragement, and one is engaged in the virtuous side.🔽In order to refresh oneself, one relies on sleep at the appropriate time.🔽When one is calming the mind, if one becomes or is afraid of becoming

original: bying bar 'gyur du dogs na /
analyzed: bying bar 'gyur du dogs na /
translated: languid,🔽one should direct one’s mind to the signs of brightness.🔽When one is walking about, before a fault arises,

original: dang par bya ba'i mtshan ma yid la byed pas zhi bar mi gnas pa dang / rgyu zhing 'gro ba na nyes pa ma byung ba'i snga rol nas /
analyzed: dang par bya ba'i mtshan ma yid la byed pas zhi bar mi gnas pa dang / rgyu zhing 'gro ba na nyes pa ma byung ba'i snga rol nas /
translated: one should direct one’s mind to the sign of mental stability.

original: de mi byed pas 'gyed pa med pa dang / gong nas gong du khyad par 'gro ba dang / gus par byed pa dang / rtag tu byed pas yang dag par sbyor ba'i lhag pa'i sems kyis bslab pa rnams yang dag par ston to //
analyzed: de mi byed pas 'gyed pa med pa dang / gong nas gong du khyad par 'gro ba dang / gus par byed pa dang / rtag tu byed pas yang dag par sbyor ba'i lhag pa'i sems kyis bslab pa rnams yang dag par ston to //
translated: He teaches the trainings of superior thought by means of correct application, since he does not engage in the above faults, since he proceeds higher and higher, since he acts respectfully, and since he acts constantly.🔽He awakens by means of engagement,

original: 'jug par byed pas sad byed dang // gzhan yang de bzhin kun du sbyor //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pas sad byed dang // gzhan yang de bzhin kun du sbyor //
translated: and likewise, he connects with the other.🔽He grasps the sign, and is attached,

original: mtshan mar 'dzin dang chags pa dang // gzhan yang de bzhin steg bar byed //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin dang chags pa dang // gzhan yang de bzhin steg bar byed //
translated: and likewise, he makes it grow.

original: 'jums pa dang ni mchog tu chags /
analyzed: 'jums pa dang ni mchog tu chags /
translated: He is conceited, and is attached to the highest,

original: rtog ba zhes ni bya ba ste //🔽'dod pa'i 'dod chags bskyed pa de //
analyzed: rtog ba zhes ni bya ba ste // 'dod pa'i 'dod chags bskyed pa de //
translated: and he is called a conceiver.

original: mkhas pas yongs su spang bar bya //
analyzed: mkhas pas yongs su spang bar bya //
translated: The wise one should completely abandon🔽the generation of desire-attachment.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags skyed pa'i rtog pa rnam pa brgyad dang po nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la 'khrig pa'i 'dod chags skyed pa'i rtog pa rnam pa brgyad dang po nas brtsams te /
translated: Here, the conceiver is the eight types of conceptions that generate desire-attachment to sexual intercourse.

original: mjug tu @218b phyin gyi bar du go rims bzhin du skye ba yongs su spangs par bslab pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ston to //
analyzed: mjug tu @218b phyin gyi bar du go rims bzhin du skye ba yongs su spangs par bslab pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par ston to //
translated: At the end, the special purity of the training in the thorough relinquishment of rebirth is shown, in order, by the terms “abandonment,” “non-abandonment,” “abandonment,” and “non-abandonment.”

original: de la 'jug par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i chags par bya ba'i gzhi de nyid la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan sems 'jug par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i chags par bya ba'i gzhi de nyid la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan sems 'jug par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The “engagement” is the engagement of the mind that is associated with incorrect mental activity in regard to the very same basis of attachment that is conceptualized as the cause of engagement.

original: sad par byed pa ni gzhi de nyid la 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris ba sad pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sad par byed pa ni gzhi de nyid la 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris ba sad pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The “arousing” is the arousing of the fetter of passion that is associated with the very same basis.

original: kun du sbyor ba ni gzhi de nyid tshol ba'o //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba ni gzhi de nyid tshol ba'o //
translated: The “bond” is the seeking of the very same basis.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni gzhi de nyid las sdug pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa sna tshogs 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni gzhi de nyid las sdug pa'i mtshan ma rnam pa sna tshogs 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The “seizing of signs” is the seizing of the various signs of beauty in the very same basis.

original: chags pa ni gzhi thob pa de nyid la lhag par chags pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa ni gzhi thob pa de nyid la lhag par chags pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The “attachment” is the possession of excessive attachment to the very same basis that has been obtained.

original: steg pa ni gzhi de nyid la rnam pa sna tshogs su longs spyod par 'dod pa sgo du mar 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: steg pa ni gzhi de nyid la rnam pa sna tshogs su longs spyod par 'dod pa sgo du mar 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment is the desire to enjoy the object in various ways, the engagement in the many doors.

original: 'jums pa ni gnyis kyi dbang po gnyis phrad ba'i dus gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jums pa ni gnyis kyi dbang po gnyis phrad ba'i dus gang yin pa'o //
translated: The embracing is the time of the union of the two organs.

original: mchog tu chags pa ni khu ba 'byung ba'i dus gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu chags pa ni khu ba 'byung ba'i dus gang yin pa'o //
translated: The supreme attachment is the time of the emission of semen.

original: 'dod ba rnams ni mi ngoms byed //
analyzed: 'dod ba rnams ni mi ngoms byed //
translated: The dissatisfaction is the desire for more and more of the object.

original: de bzhin mang po thun mong yin //
analyzed: de bzhin mang po thun mong yin //
translated: The commonality is the fact that many people desire the same object.

original: chos ma yin pa'i rgyur gyur dang // de bzhin sred pa 'phel bar byed //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i rgyur gyur dang // de bzhin sred pa 'phel bar byed //
translated: The cause of unrighteousness is the fact that one commits evil deeds for the sake of the object.🔽The increase of craving is the fact that one desires more and more objects.

original: dam pa rnams kyis stong ba'i 'os //
analyzed: dam pa rnams kyis stong ba'i 'os //
translated: The unsuitability for the holy is the fact that the holy ones abandon the objects.🔽The swift destruction is the fact that the objects are quickly exhausted.

original: myur du 'jig par 'gyur ba dang // 'dod rnams rkyen la brten pa dang // bag med gyi ni sa yang yin //
analyzed: myur du 'jig par 'gyur ba dang // 'dod rnams rkyen la brten pa dang // bag med gyi ni sa yang yin //
translated: The dependence on conditions is the fact that the objects are not under one's control.🔽The basis of heedlessness is the fact that the objects lead to carelessness.

original: zhes bya ba rnam pa brgyad kyis ni ci rigs par tshe 'di nyid dang / tshe phyi ma'i 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs bstan pas 'dod pa la 'dun pa spong ba'i thabs ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rnam pa brgyad kyis ni ci rigs par tshe 'di nyid dang / tshe phyi ma'i 'dod pa rnams kyi nyes dmigs bstan pas 'dod pa la 'dun pa spong ba'i thabs ston to //
translated: By these eight aspects, the faults of the objects in this life and in future lives are shown as appropriate, teaching the means of abandoning desire and attachment.

original: 'dod pa rnams ni keng rus 'dra //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams ni keng rus 'dra //
translated: Desires are like skeletons,

original: de bzhin sha yi kha mtshad 'dra //
analyzed: de bzhin sha yi kha mtshad 'dra //
translated: and also like a piece of meat.🔽They are like a grass torch,

original: rtsva yi sgron ma 'dra ba dang // de bzhin me yi dong dang 'dra /
analyzed: rtsva yi sgron ma 'dra ba dang // de bzhin me yi dong dang 'dra /
translated: and also like a pit of fire.🔽They are like a poisonous snake,🔽and also like a dream,🔽like a borrowed ornament,

original: gdug pa'i sprul dang 'dra pa dang // de bzhin rmi lam lta bu dang // brnyan po'i rgyan dang 'dra ba dang // de bzhin shing thog 'dra ba yin //
analyzed: gdug pa'i sprul dang 'dra pa dang // de bzhin rmi lam lta bu dang // brnyan po'i rgyan dang 'dra ba dang // de bzhin shing thog 'dra ba yin //
translated: and also like a borrowed fruit.

original: 'dod rnams de ltar shes nas ni //
analyzed: 'dod rnams de ltar shes nas ni //
translated: Knowing desires to be like this,

original: ji lta bur yang chags mi bya //
analyzed: ji lta bur yang chags mi bya //
translated: one should not be attached to them at all.

original: zhes bya ba 'di la 'dod pa rnams doms par mi byed pa la sogs pa rnam pa brgyad po sngar bstan pa'i nyes dmigs 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'i dper gzhag pa rnams kyis nyes dmigs su ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la 'dod pa rnams doms par mi byed pa la sogs pa rnam pa brgyad po sngar bstan pa'i nyes dmigs 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'i dper gzhag pa rnams kyis nyes dmigs su ston te /
translated: Here, the faults of not being satisfied with desires and so on, the eight mentioned above, are taught to be faults by means of examples that are well known to everyone.

original: de kho na ltar nyes dmigs mang po bstan na /
analyzed: de kho na ltar nyes dmigs mang po bstan na /
translated: Having taught the many faults in just this way,

original: de dag la mkhas pa ga la zhig mngon par chags par byed ces bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la mkhas pa ga la zhig mngon par chags par byed ces bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: how could the wise become attached to them?

original: @219a * // de la ngoms par mi byed pa ni keng rus dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @219a * // de la ngoms par mi byed pa ni keng rus dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not satisfying, like a skeleton.

original: mang po dang thun mong ba ni /
analyzed: mang po dang thun mong ba ni /
translated: It is shared by many,

original: sha'i kham tshad dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sha'i kham tshad dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: like a piece of meat.

original: chos ma yin pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba ni //
translated: It is a cause of unrighteousness,

original: rtsva'i sgron ma dang 'dra ste /🔽ma bor na tshig par 'gyur ba nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //🔽sred pa 'phel bar byed pa ni me dong lta bu ste /
analyzed: rtsva'i sgron ma dang 'dra ste / ma bor na tshig par 'gyur ba nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro // sred pa 'phel bar byed pa ni me dong lta bu ste /
translated: like a grass torch.🔽It is a cause of burning, like a grass torch.🔽It increases craving, like a pit of fire.

original: skom par byed pa dang tshul 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skom par byed pa dang tshul 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a cause of thirst.

original: dam pa rnams kyis spong ba'i 'os su gyur pa ni /
analyzed: dam pa rnams kyis spong ba'i 'os su gyur pa ni /
translated: It is to be abandoned by the holy ones,

original: sbrul gdug pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbrul gdug pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: like a poisonous snake.

original: myur du 'jig par 'gyur ba ni rmi lam dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myur du 'jig par 'gyur ba ni rmi lam dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is quickly destroyed, like a dream.

original: rkyen la brten pa ni brnyan po'i rgyan dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen la brten pa ni brnyan po'i rgyan dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is dependent on conditions, like a borrowed ornament.

translated: “Cultivation with a single aim” is

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

translated: think that living in a household is a problem and

analyzed: de de ltar rab tu byung nas /

analyzed: de las langs na yang de grong ngam grong rdal gang la brten zhing gnas pa na /

analyzed: de lus shin tu bsrungs pa dang / dbang po rnams shin tu bsdams pa dang / dran pas shin tu gnas pas grong ngam grong rdal de nyid du 'jug pa dang / rgyu ba dang phyir 'byung bar byed do //

analyzed: lus las su rung ba dang / sems las su rung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de ltar de dran pa dang / shes bzhin la brten pas /

translated: He abandons desire and attains the first meditative concentration, which is free from the hindrances and endowed with the joy and pleasure born of seclusion.

analyzed: phal pa so so'i skye bo pa spangs shing yongs su shes pa yin no //
translated: In this way, he abandons and fully understands the bad and unwholesome practices that are the extreme of indulgence in sense pleasures, which are the domain of ordinary, foolish people.

original: gnod pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnod pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meditative concentration that is associated with pain and has sluggish direct knowledge?

original: 'di ltar 'di na dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na dge sbyong ngam /
translated: Here a monastic

original: bram ze la la bdag nyid kyis dka' thub drag po byas te /
analyzed: bram ze la la bdag nyid kyis dka' thub drag po byas te /
translated: Some brahmins practice severe austerities themselves.

original: tshe 'di la sdug bsngal gyi rnam grangs du ma nyams su len pas bdag nyid kun du gdung zhing rab tu gdung la yongs su gdung bar byed de /
analyzed: tshe 'di la sdug bsngal gyi rnam grangs du ma nyams su len pas bdag nyid kun du gdung zhing rab tu gdung la yongs su gdung bar byed de /
translated: They undergo many different kinds of suffering in this life, tormenting themselves, tormenting themselves thoroughly, and tormenting themselves completely.

original: tshe 'di la sdug bsngal nyams su blangs pa 'dis bdag sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par 'gyur ro snyam pa las /
analyzed: tshe 'di la sdug bsngal nyams su blangs pa 'dis bdag sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par 'gyur ro snyam pa las /
translated: They think, “By undergoing suffering in this life, I will be completely liberated from suffering.”

analyzed: de gang gi don du yongs su gdung bar byed pa'i don de yang ma thob la /
translated: But they do not attain the goal for which they torment themselves.

analyzed: phongs pa chen po'i skal ba can du 'gyur ba de ni gnod pa dang ldan pa'i @220b sdug bsngal zhes bya ste /
translated: They become the possessors of a great misfortune. This is called “the suffering of harm.”

original: 'phags pa nyan thos des de ltar bdag nyid ngal bar byed pa'i mtha'/
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos des de ltar bdag nyid ngal bar byed pa'i mtha'/
translated: Noble disciples understand that the end of exhausting oneself in this way

analyzed: sdug bsngal ba 'phags pa'i ma yin pa gnod pa dang ldan pa de rtogs nas ring du yongs su spong bar byed de /

original: mi bsten mi bsnyen cing 'grogs par mi byed do //
analyzed: mi bsten mi bsnyen cing 'grogs par mi byed do //
translated: They do not rely on it, do not attend to it, and do not associate with it.

original: bshad pa 'di'i mdor bstan pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa 'di'i mdor bstan pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The summary of this explanation is as follows:

original: mdor bstan pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: mdor bstan pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the summary?

original: sems can rnams kyi 'byor pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi 'byor pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The prosperity of sentient beings is twofold:

original: mngon par mtho ba'i 'byor ba dang / nges par legs pa'i 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba'i 'byor ba dang / nges par legs pa'i 'byor pa'o //
translated: the prosperity of high status and the prosperity of definite goodness.

original: de la mngon par mtho ba'i 'byor pa ni bde 'gror 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de la mngon par mtho ba'i 'byor pa ni bde 'gror 'gro ba'o //
translated: Among them, the prosperity of high status is going to a happy🔽realm.🔽The prosperity of definite goodness is called the exhaustion of craving,

original: nges par legs pa'i 'byor pa ni sred pa zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nges par legs pa'i 'byor pa ni sred pa zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
translated: the absence of attachment, cessation, and nirvāṇa.

analyzed: 'byor pa 'di gnyis ni bgegs byed pa spong bas 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: These two prosperities are attained by abandoning the obstructions.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad dang / gzhi thams cad dang / gnas thams cad du thabs kyi nyes par spyod par mi byed pa gang yin pa de mngon par mtho ba'i 'byor pa la bgegs byed pa spong ba ste /
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad dang / gzhi thams cad dang / gnas thams cad du thabs kyi nyes par spyod par mi byed pa gang yin pa de mngon par mtho ba'i 'byor pa la bgegs byed pa spong ba ste /
translated: Among them, the abandonment of the obstructions to the prosperity of high status is the avoidance of all forms, all bases, and all situations of the misdeeds of method.

original: mngon par mtho ba'i 'byor pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba'i 'byor pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One attains the prosperity of high status.
